---
title: "advanced.yml"
---

## High-level description
This YAML file contains advanced configuration settings for a software system, likely a server application. It defines various aspects of the system including auditing, logging, CORS, caching, server settings, tracing, storage, database connection, authentication, and authorization. The configuration is comprehensive and covers multiple components of the application.

## Symbols

### `audit`
#### Description
Configures the audit logging system.

#### Internal Logic
- Enables log sink
- Specifies log file path
- Sets buffer capacity and flush period

### `log`
#### Description
Configures the general logging system.

#### Internal Logic
- Sets log level to WARN
- Specifies log file and encoding
- Defines custom keys for time, level, and message

### `cors`
#### Description
Configures Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) settings.

#### Internal Logic
- Enables CORS
- Specifies allowed origins and headers

### `cache`
#### Description
Configures the caching system.

#### Internal Logic
- Enables caching with memory backend
- Sets TTL and eviction interval

### `server`
#### Description
Configures the server settings.

#### Internal Logic
- Sets protocol to HTTPS
- Specifies host and ports for HTTP, HTTPS, and gRPC
- Defines SSL certificate and key file paths

### `tracing`
#### Description
Configures distributed tracing.

#### Internal Logic
- Enables tracing with OpenTelemetry (OTLP) exporter
- Specifies OTLP endpoint

### `storage`
#### Description
Configures the storage system.

#### Internal Logic
- Uses Git as storage type
- Specifies repository URL, reference, and polling interval
- Sets up basic authentication for Git

### `db`
#### Description
Configures the database connection.

#### Internal Logic
- Specifies PostgreSQL connection URL
- Sets connection pool parameters

### `meta`
#### Description
Configures metadata and telemetry settings.

#### Internal Logic
- Disables update checks and telemetry

### `authentication`
#### Description
Configures the authentication system.

#### Internal Logic
- Requires authentication
- Sets up session parameters
- Configures multiple authentication methods: token, OIDC, Kubernetes, and GitHub
- Specifies cleanup intervals and grace periods for each method

### `authorization`
#### Description
Configures the authorization system.

#### Internal Logic
- Requires authorization
- Uses local backend
- Specifies policy and data file paths with polling intervals

### `experimental`
#### Description
Configures experimental features.

#### Internal Logic
- Enables experimental authorization feature

## Dependencies
This configuration file doesn't directly depend on external libraries, but it suggests the use of various technologies and services:

| Dependency | Purpose |
|:-----------|:--------|
| PostgreSQL | Database backend |
| Git | Storage backend |
| OpenTelemetry | Distributed tracing |
| Kubernetes | Authentication method |
| GitHub | Authentication method |
| OIDC | Authentication method |

## Configuration
This entire file is a configuration. Key configuration options include:

| Option | Type | Default | Description |
|:-------|:-----|:--------|:------------|
| audit.sinks.log.enabled | boolean | true | Enables audit logging |
| log.level | string | WARN | Sets the logging level |
| cors.enabled | boolean | true | Enables CORS |
| cache.enabled | boolean | true | Enables caching |
| server.protocol | string | https | Sets the server protocol |
| tracing.enabled | boolean | true | Enables distributed tracing |
| storage.type | string | git | Sets the storage backend type |
| authentication.required | boolean | true | Requires authentication |
| authorization.required | boolean | true | Requires authorization |

Note: This table includes only a subset of the configuration options. The file contains many more detailed settings for each component.
